fields.Description/Abstract:
This forum reflects the impact of COVID-19 and the Black Lives Matter movement on the teaching of late-19th-century American literature. Spread over Winter and Spring 2021 journal issues, it contains two introductions by me and the following essays:
“Black Realism Matters” 
“Paul Laurence Dunbar: ‘When Malindy Sings,’ The Sport of the Gods, and Black Lives Matter”  
“Maria Amparo Ruiz de Burton, ‘White Slaves,’ and Mexican Representation in the American Realist Chronology” 
“Lessons from the ‘City of Print’” – 3 authors 
“Teaching Utopia during Dystopian Times” 
“Realism and Recording” 
“Teaching Realism of Jim Crow America”
